sourceText: Millions of children face interruptions with schooling and often feel isolated from friends and peers.
text: Izigidi zezingane zihlangabezana nokuphazamiseka bese zizizwa zibandlululekile ebanganini nontanga.

sourceText: This tip is about learning through play – something that can be fun for all ages!
text: Leli cebiso limayelana nokufunda ngokudlala - into engathokozelwa abantu beminyaka yonke!

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Ukuthola imininingwane eyengeziwe chofoza izixhumanisi ezingezansi:

sourceText: Telling stories.
text: Ukuxoxa izindaba.

sourceText: Tell your children a story from your own childhood.
text: Xoxela izingane zakho indaba kusukela ebuntwaneni bakho.

sourceText: Ask your children to tell you a story.
text: Cela izingane zakho ukuba zikuxoxele indaba.

sourceText: Make up a new story together starting with “Once upon a time…” Each person adds a new sentence to the story.
text: Yenzani indaba entsha ndawonye niqale ngokuthi “Kwasukasukela…” Umuntu ngamunye uzokwengeza umusho endabani.

sourceText: Act out a favorite story or movie – older children can even direct younger ones while learning responsibility.
text: Lingisani indaba eniyithandayo noma ifilimu – izingane ezindala zingase ziqondise ezincane njengoba zifunda umsebenzi.

sourceText: Change the object!
text: Shintsha into!

sourceText: Every day household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games.
text: Izinto ezisetshenziswa nsuku zonke ekhaya ezinjengemishanelo, amamophu, noma izikhafu kungaba yizinto zokuzijabulisa zemidlalo.

sourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be.
text: Beka into phakathi negumbi nomshanelo futhi uma kukhona onombono, agxumele phakathi ese ebonisa wonke umuntu ukuthi leyonto kungaba yini.

sourceText: For example, a broom might become a horse, microphone, or even a guitar!
text: Ngokwesibonelo, umshanelo ungaba yihhashi, umbhobho, noma isiginci!

sourceText: Movement games.
text: Imidlalo yokunyakaza.

sourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs. First person does a dance move and everyone else copies. Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Qamba ubuciko bomdanso wengoma ethandwa yizingane zakho. Umuntu wokuqala wenza umdanso bese bonke abanye bayamlingisa. Wonke umuntu uyashintshana ngokuba ngumholi.

sourceText: “Challenge” who can do the most toe touches, jumping jacks, or laps around the room in a minute.
text: "Phosa inselelo" ubani okwazi ukuthinta izinzwane kakhulu, ukugxuma, noma  ukugxumagxuma egunjini ngomzuzu.

sourceText: “Mirror” each other’s facial expressions, movements, sounds. One person can start as the leader and then switch. Try it with no leaders!
text: “Isibuko" ubuso bomunye nomunye, ukunyakaza, imisindo. Umuntu oyedwa angaqala njengomholi bese niyashintshana. Kuzameni ngaphandle komholi!

sourceText: Freeze dance: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances. When the music stops, everyone must freeze. Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Umdanso wokunganyakazi: Dlala umculo noma othile acule, bese wonke umuntu uyadansa. Uma umculo uma, wonke umuntu kumele ame anganyakazi. Umuntu ozogcina ukuma uba yijaji ngokulandelayo.

sourceText: Animal dance: Same as above but when the music stops, call out a name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: Umdanso wezilwane: Njengasenhla kodwa uma umculo uma, biza igama lesilwane, bese wonke umuntu kufanele abe yileso silwane.

sourceText: Types of play.
text: Izinhlobo zemidlalo.

sourceText: Learning through Play
text: Ukufunda Ngokudlala

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Ukuba Ngumzali Ngesikhathi se-COVID-19

sourceText: tips from WHO
text: amacebiso avela kwa-WHO

sourceText: tips from UNICEF
text: amacebiso avela kwa-UNICEF

sourceText: other languages
text: ezinye izilimi

sourceText: evidence-base
text: Isisekelo sobufakazi

sourceText: Singing.
text: Ukucula.

sourceText: Singing songs to your baby or young child helps develop language.
text: Ukuculela usana noma ingane yakho encane amaculo kusiza ukuthuthukisa ulimi.

sourceText: Play or sing a song, and the first one to guess it right becomes the next leader.
text: Dlala noma ucule ingoma, futhi owokuqala ukuyiqagela kahle uzoba ngumholi olandelayo.

sourceText: Make up a song about handwashing or physical distancing. Add dance movements!
text: Yenza ingoma ngokugeza izandla noma ukuqhelelana. Faka iminyakazo yokudansa!

sourceText: Memory game.
text: Umdlalo wenkumbulo.

sourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to...” (e.g, go to the park).
text: Umuntu wokuqala uthi, “Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizo..." (isib, ngizoya epaki).

sourceText: Second person adds to first person, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”.
text: Umuntu wesibili uzokwengeza kowokuqala, "Uma i-COVID-19 iphela, ngizoya epaki futhi...(isib., ngivakashele umngane wami omkhulu)".

sourceText: Each person adds to the previous trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Umuntu ngamunye wengeza kokudlule ezama ukucabanga ngezinto ezijabulisayo angazenza uma kuphela i-COVID-19.

sourceText: You can change this to any scenario in the future (e.g., when I see my friends).
text: Ungakushintsha lokhu kube yinoma yisiphi isimo ngokuzayo (isib., uma ngibona abangane bami).

sourceText: There are many different types of play that can be both fun AND educational.
text: Kunezinhlobo eziningi zemidlalo ezingaba mnandi FUTHI zifundise.

sourceText: Language, numbers, objects, drama, and music games give children opportunities to explore and express themselves in a safe and fun way.
text: Izilimi, izinombolo, izinto, imidlalo yeshashalazi, nemidlalo yomculo kunikeza izingane amathuba okuhlola nokuziveza ngendlela ephephile nejabulisayo.

sourceText: Partners
text: Ophathina

sourceText: Funders
text: Abaxhasi
